results.adx_keywords: Soccer;Deaths (Obituaries);Football (College);England;Tham Luang Nang Non Cave (Thailand);Thailand
results.byline: By Isabella Kwai and Muktita Suhartono
results.title: Thai Soccer Player Who Survived Cave Flooding Dies at 17
results.abstract: Duangphet Promthep, 17, was a member of the soccer team that escaped from a submerged cave in Thailand in 2018 and later attended a soccer academy in England. The cause of his death was unclear.

media.caption: Duangphet Promthep, one of the boys rescued from the flooded cave in northern Thailand, with relatives after his return home in 2018.

results.adx_keywords: Lotteries;California
results.title: Winner of Record $2 Billion Powerball Jackpot Is Revealed
results.abstract: Edwin Castro was the only lottery player in the country to match all six numbers in the Nov. 7 Powerball drawing, earning him the largest payout in lottery history, California Lottery officials said.

media.caption: Alva Johnson, the California State Lottery director, announced on Tuesday that Edwin Castro had won the record-high $2.04 billion Powerball jackpot in November. Mr. Castro declined to appear at the news conference.

results.adx_keywords: Latin Music;Content Type: Personal Profile;Karol G (Singer)
results.title: Karol G’s Songs Conquered the World. On a New LP, She Reveals Herself.
results.abstract: “Mañana Será Bonito,” the Colombian pop superstar’s fourth album, traces her adventures in (and out) of love, with guests including Shakira and Romeo Santos.

media.caption: “I’m being really open with this album, and that gets me a little bit scared, because I’m not a perfect human,” Karol G said.
media.copyright: Jingyu Lin for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Actors and Actresses;Nineteen Hundred Sixties;Movies;Welch, Raquel
results.title: Raquel Welch, Actress and ’60s Sex Symbol, Is Dead at 82
results.abstract: Beginning with a doeskin bikini in “One Million Years B.C.,” she built a celebrated show business career around sex appeal and, sometimes, a comic touch.

media.caption: When Playboy in 1998 named the 100 sexiest female stars of the 20th century, Raquel Welch came in third, after Marilyn Monroe and Jayne Mansfield.

results.adx_keywords: Radio;Weather;Sleep;British Broadcasting Corp;Great Britain
results.title: A Secret for Falling Asleep So Good It’s a British National Treasure
results.abstract: Tune into serenity with the BBC Shipping Forecast, a weather report from deep in the analog era.

results.adx_keywords: Hazardous and Toxic Substances;Railroad Accidents and Safety;Chemicals;Pollution;Evacuations and Evacuees;Norfolk Southern Corporation;Environmental Protection Agency;National Transportation Safety Board;East Palestine (Ohio)
results.title: After the Ohio Train Derailment: Evacuations, Toxic Chemicals and Water Worries
results.abstract: When a train derailed in the village of East Palestine this month, it set off evacuation orders, a chemical scare and a federal investigation.

results.adx_keywords: Social Security (US);Politics and Government;United States Politics and Government;National Debt (US);Medicare;Retirement;Congressional Budget Office;Republican Party
results.title: As Lawmakers Spar Over Social Security, Its Costs Are Rising Fast
results.abstract: New budget projections show that the program’s spending is outpacing tax revenues as an aging population claims benefits.

media.caption: President Biden has forced Republican leaders to profess, repeatedly, that they will not seek cuts to Social Security and Medicare.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Murdaugh, Alex (1968- );Murdaugh, Margaret (d 2021);Murdaugh, Paul (d 2021);South Carolina
results.title: Murdaugh ‘Never Talked’ With Relative About Finding His Family’s Killer
results.abstract: Alex Murdaugh’s sister-in-law, the first close family member to testify at his murder trial, said he had been more interested in protecting his son’s reputation than in finding the person who murdered him.

media.caption: Alex Murdaugh on Tuesday at his murder trial at the Colleton County Courthouse in Walterboro, S.C.

results.adx_keywords: Courts and the Judiciary;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Sex Crimes;Carroll, E Jean;Kaplan, Lewis A;Trump, Donald J;Manhattan (NYC)
results.title: Trump’s Offer to Provide DNA in Rape Suit Is Stalling Tactic, Judge Says
results.abstract: E. Jean Carroll has accused the former president of assaulting her in a department store dressing room decades ago. A trial is set for April.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump has said he never met the woman who has accused him of rape.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.title: What Toxic Chemicals Were Aboard the Derailed Train in Ohio?
results.abstract: The train was carrying industrial materials used in plastics, paint thinners and other products, according to information provided to the federal government.
org_facet: Agency for Toxic Substances and Disease Registry

media.caption: Workers prepare to enter the area where the disaster took place.

results.title: No More Spring Trainings
results.abstract: John Jaso walked away from Major League Baseball at 34, potentially leaving millions of dollars on the table. The sea was calling.

results.adx_keywords: Michigan State University Shooting (Feb 13, 2023);Content Type: Personal Profile;McRae, Anthony D (1979-2023);Michigan State University;Ewing Township (NJ);Lansing (Mich);Trenton (NJ)
results.byline: By James C. McKinley Jr. and Tracey Tully
results.title: What We Know About the Gunman Behind the Michigan State Attack
results.abstract: The man the police say shot eight students, three fatally, before killing himself had roots in New Jersey and no apparent connection to the university.

media.caption: Michigan State University canceled classes at its campus in East Lansing, Mich., on Tuesday after a mass shooting Monday evening.
media.copyright: Nick Hagen for The New York Times

results.title: Florida College Cancels Concert Over Gay Singer, Drawing Backlash
results.abstract: Pensacola Christian College called off an appearance by the King’s Singers, citing the “lifestyle” of a member.

media.caption: The King’s Singers, a British a cappella ensemble.

results.adx_keywords: Libraries and Librarians;Books and Literature;American Library Assn
results.byline: By Elisabeth Egan and Erica Ackerberg
results.title: A Love Letter to Libraries, Long Overdue
results.abstract: The New York Times sent photographers to seven states to document the thrum and buzz in buildings once known for silence.

media.caption: Siblings explored the children’s room at the Bemidji Public Library in Bemidji, Minn.
media.copyright: Jaida Grey Eagle for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Doctors;Diet and Nutrition;Medicine and Health;Research;your-feed-health;your-feed-healthcare;Journal of General Internal Medicine;BMJ (Journal)
results.title: According to Medical Guidelines, Your Doctor Needs a 27-Hour Workday
results.abstract: Some doctors say that however reasonable guidelines may seem, their cumulative burden causes “constant frustration” to medical practice.

media.caption: A study last year found that a doctor following all the major guidelines for preventive, chronic and acute disease care would need nearly 27 hours per day with their patients.
media.copyright: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times

results.title: Everyone Wants Your Email Address. Think Twice Before Sharing It.
results.abstract: Your email address has become a digital bread crumb for companies to link your activity across sites. Here’s how you can limit this.

results.adx_keywords: Weather;Tornadoes;National Weather Service;Southern States (US);Alabama;Gulf Coast (US);Lake Erie;Georgia;Mississippi;Ohio;Texas;Tennessee;Memphis (Tenn)
results.title: Severe Storms Could Bring Tornadoes to the South
results.abstract: The risk stretched from Texas to Kentucky on Wednesday and could reach from the Gulf Coast of Alabama to the shore of Lake Erie in western New York on Thursday, forecasters said.

media.caption: An enhanced risk of severe storms capable of producing tornadoes is possible across much of the South on Wednesday and Thursday, according to the Storm Prediction Center.

results.title: The Law Is Closing In on Trump
results.abstract: The decision whether to indict Trump should be based on the law, not on a fear of the consequences of indicting him.

results.adx_keywords: Railroad Accidents and Safety;Decisions and Verdicts;DeWine, Mike;NewsNation;East Palestine (Ohio)
results.title: Charges Dismissed for Reporter Arrested While Covering Ohio Train Derailment
results.abstract: Evan Lambert, a NewsNation reporter, was arrested on Feb. 8 while doing a live shot at a news conference where the governor of Ohio was speaking.

media.caption: In this police bodycam footage provided by Ohio State Highway Patrol, NewsNation correspondent Evan Lambert, center, interacts with the leader of the Ohio National Guard in the gymnasium of an elementary school in East Palestine, Ohio, on Wednesday, Feb. 8, 2023.
media.copyright: Ohio State Highway Patrol, via Associated Press
